title: Ticket #453: Short-term fix for Condor-C ignoring job lease renewal of running jobs
description:
We need an immediate short term fix for the problem described in #452.

The plan is when the shadow connects to the schedd to push updates received from the starter into the persistent queue, it should also read a fresh copy of the job classad in order to renew its cached copy. It is important the the shadow does this after it pushes its updates (so the starter updates are not lost), and that is happens on the same schedd connection (for performance reasons).

A patch to the vanilla shadow to implement the above will be attached to this ticket, and a version of the schedd that the BatLab can test with will be made available asap. However, this patch should not be shipped as part of a release, and therefore should not be pushed into the source code repository.
remarks:
2009-May-05 14:08:32 by zmiller:
patch attached, but has minor differences:

1) there is a config knob, ALWAYS_UPDATE_JOB_AD_ON_PERIODIC_EVALUATION, which must be set to true to enable this feature.

2) on EVERY periodic timer it updates to the schedd and then pulls the new ad. this is less efficient but more correct.

2009-May-26 13:18:14 by tannenba:
The patches, as they now stand, are broken because onexit expressions now results in a shadow exception. The problem is job termination attributes, like JobExit (exit code), are being wiped out when the patch fetches the job ad from the schedd.

The proposed fix would be for the shadow to do a 3-way classad merge (previously seen shadow ad, current shadow ad, schedd ad) in the patch instead of just replacing the internal shadow ad w/ what we get from the schedd.

2009-Oct-28 16:55:23 by jfrey:
I removed the old hack with ALWAYS_UPDATE_JOB_AD_ON_PERIODIC_EVALUATION and added code to QmgrJobUpdater to pull attributes from the schedd when it connects, as originally described in this ticket.

Some further improvements could be made to this code:

  • Adjust periodic update interval based on when the job lease from the submitter is set to expire.
  • Scan the job policy expressions for other attributes that should be updated from the schedd.

Note: these patches will appear in v7.4.1

2009-Nov-25 16:08:44 by bgietzel:
checkin [16199] did not make it into Condor 7.4.0. Using a large job lease duration and disabling the previous patch is a workaround. 

ALWAYS_UPDATE_JOB_AD_ON_PERIODIC_EVALUATION = FALSE
JOB_LEASE_DURATION = 5000000
SUBMIT_EXPRS = JOB_LEASE_DURATION
